intro: Chaenorhinum minus, commonly known as the lesser yellowhead, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ease of growth.
